boat.name: Tinkerbell
boat.full_description:
Tinkerbell is a Bembridge scow (11ft 3" x 4ft9") built by A.A. Coombes in approx. 1955. Coombes still builds dinghys and tell me they did not give them numbers. I was given the dinghy when it was in poor condition with many split lands but restored it using epoxy (see PBO article August 2020 Restoring a Bembridge Scow. This article is also available on the internet). I have also put in Mahogany side thwarts to make her more comfortable to sit in. She traditionally had an orange lug sail but this was rotten so I replaced it with a new white sail with No 4 on it. She has a small foredeck.

Now fully restored she sails very well.
boat.short_description: Tinkerbell is a Bembridge scow (11ft 3" x 4ft9") built by A.A. Coombes in approx. 1955.
